title: How to Reduce Eye Bags with Coffee Grounds

steps.title: Pour 2 tsp (1.6 g) of coffee grounds into a bowl.
steps.content: Pour 2 tsp (1.6 g) of coffee grounds into a bowl. Pinch or scoop a few spoonfuls of coffee grounds into a small bowl. If you’ve already brewed a pot of coffee, use the old grounds from the pot. If you’re using fresh grounds, add a few drops of water into the bowl to make the coffee moist and easier to apply. If the coffee isn’t moist, then it won’t adhere to your skin very well. Coffee powder can also work for this treatment! If you’re using instant coffee packets, 1 sachet should do the trick. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Mix in 0.5 tablespoons (7.4 mL) of honey to make your skin feel smooth.
steps.content: Mix in 0.5 tablespoons (7.4 mL) of honey to make your skin feel smooth. Squeeze a small amount of liquid honey into your bowl of coffee grounds, then use a spoon to stir the mixture together. While you don’t have to add extra ingredients to your coffee grounds, the honey makes the grounds a bit easier to apply to the skin. [4] X Research source This works especially well with coffee powder. Honey also helps make your skin feel soft. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Stir in an egg white if you don’t want to use honey.
steps.content: Stir in an egg white if you don’t want to use honey. Separate and pour 1 egg white into your bowl of coffee grounds. Using a spoon or whisk, mix the grounds and egg together until the texture is smooth and consistent. [6] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Egg whites can help firm and tighten away any obvious wrinkles.

steps.title: Pour in 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of water to make the mixture runny.
steps.content: Pour in 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of water to make the mixture runny. Before applying the mask, add in a small amount of cool tap water into the mixture. Stir all 3 ingredients together until the mask has a smooth, even consistency. [7] X Research source The mixture should resemble slightly thickened chocolate milk. If you’re using an egg white, you don’t need to include water. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Dip your fingers into the coffee grounds.
steps.content: Dip your fingers into the coffee grounds. Coat your pointer and middle finger with the coffee grounds. If you didn’t add honey or water to the grounds, you might have to scoop the coffee onto your fingertips. [9] X Research source If you included honey and water in your coffee mixture, consider using a thick makeup brush to apply the mixture.

steps.title: Spread the grounds in a curved, 1 in (2.5 cm) line beneath your eye.
steps.content: Spread the grounds in a curved, 1 in (2.5 cm) line beneath your eye. Apply the coffee grounds beneath the inner corner of your eye. Move your fingers slowly, so you don’t get any grounds in your eyes. As you apply the coffee to your under eye area, focus on creating a line that’s around 1 in (2.5 cm) thick. Then, repeat the process on your opposite eye. [10] X Research source Always work outwards from the inner corner of your eye. If necessary, dip into the coffee mixture again to evenly coat the skin. Double check that you’ve covered the entirety of your under eye bags with the coffee before letting the grounds sit on your skin.

steps.title: Leave the grounds beneath your eyes for 15 minutes.
steps.content: Leave the grounds beneath your eyes for 15 minutes. Set a timer as you go about the rest of your morning routine. At this point, try not to move your head around too much, or the grounds might fall from your skin. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Wash off your face with tepid water.
steps.content: Wash off your face with tepid water. Dip a clean cloth or tissue in warm water and gently wipe your skin. After the coffee mixture is gone, use another damp cloth or tissue to finish cleaning off your skin. At this point, look in the mirror to see if you notice a difference in your eye bags! [12] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Try not to use hot water to rinse your face, or you might irritate your skin. Don’t be discouraged if you don’t see any visible results. Coffee grounds don’t yield the same results for everyone!

steps.title: Repeat this process twice a week, or as needed.
steps.content: Repeat this process twice a week, or as needed. Once or twice each week, continue applying coffee grounds over your eye bags. Perform the treatment on days when your bags are especially prominent, like when you first wake up. As you go about your normal schedule, try incorporating this new treatment into your standard skincare routine. [13] X Research source
